entry.title: Binance CEO CZ Praises France’s ‘Pro-Crypto Regulations’
entry.summary: Binance announced a €100 million investment in France back in November. Now it’s moving into Paris start-up incubator Station F.

entry.title: Chainalysis Adds 'Internet of Blockchains' Cronos to Its Compliance Software
entry.summary: Chainalysis adds support for 'Internet of Blockchains' Cronos to its Know Your Transaction (KYT) software.

entry.title: Ethereum Merge Pushed to Q3 As 'Final Chapter' of Proof-of-Work Looms
entry.summary: The Ethereum 2.0 upgrade that will see the network switch to proof-of-stake will come ‘in the few months after’ June, according to devs.

entry.title: Luno Partners With London Music Venue KOKO As Crypto Moves Beyond Sports Deals
entry.summary: Crypto platform Luno has partnered with KOKO, a well-known music venue in Camden, London, in a deal that will offer perks to Luno customers.

entry.title: Facebook Whistleblower Rebukes Meta's 'Grandiose Promises' for Metaverse Safety
entry.summary: Users’ privacy is at stake as the social media giant’s metaverse push gathers steam, argues Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen.

entry.title: Nexo Partners with Mastercard, DiPocket to Launch Crypto Card
entry.summary: The Nexo Card will enable users to access a crypto credit line, using their digital assets as collateral rather than spending them.

entry.title: Sega Lays Groundwork for Metaverse With 'Super Game' NFT Plan
entry.summary: Sega’s five-year ‘Super Game’ plan will see it develop titles that "go beyond the traditional framework of games".

entry.title: The Life of a Crypto Artist: Pplpleasr on NFTs, Memes and 'Idea Sex'
entry.summary: NFT artist Emily Yang, aka pplpleasr, explains her creative process, and her path to becoming one of the leading lights of the crypto art scene.

entry.title: SHIB, ApeCoin Defy Crypto Market Slump With Double-Digit Gains
entry.summary: Shiba Inu and ApeCoin are up around 20% and 10% respectively, despite the wider crypto market slumping.

entry.title: Steve Aoki, Ashton Kutcher, Paris Hilton Join $87 Million MoonPay Investment Group
entry.summary: MoonPay followed up a $555 million Series A with a celeb-packed investment round that includes Gwyneth Paltrow, Gal Gadot and Brie Larson.

entry.title: Avatar Platform Genies Now Worth $1B After $150M Series C Round
entry.summary: Genies, which has an NFT marketplace on Dapper Labs’ Flow blockchain, is promising users “full commercialization rights” over characters.

entry.title: Pantera Says It's Raised $1.3 Billion for Blockchain Fund, Plans to Raise More in 2023
entry.summary: The venture capital firm is building its war chest as spending on Web3 ramps up.

entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Competition Soars Despite Declining On-Chain Activity
entry.summary: Though the transaction count and fees are down, Bitcoin mining has become more difficult than ever.

entry.title: Ethereum Trader Bought $400K in Tokens on Coinbase Shortlist—Before It Was Public
entry.summary: An Ethereum wallet went on a token shopping spree, focusing entirely on assets Coinbase later revealed it is considering listing. Those tokens have jumped in price by 42%.

entry.title: Celsius Phasing Out High-Interest Crypto Accounts for Non-Accredited US Investors
entry.summary: Last call for token rewards on Earn accounts.

entry.title: Ethereum Dev Virgil Griffith Gets Five Years in Prison for North Korea Trip
entry.summary: Griffith was arrested in 2019 and charged with conspiring to help North Koreans evade sanctions via cryptocurrency.

entry.title: What Fidelity’s Crypto and Metaverse ETFs Will Mean for Investors
entry.summary: New Fidelity crypto and metaverse ETFs will invest in tech and digital payments companies, but not offer direct exposure to cryptocurrencies.

entry.title: Shiba Inu (SHIB) Jumps 20% Following Robinhood Listing
entry.summary: Popular trading app Robinhood listed several more cryptocurrencies today. Meme coin Shiba Inu is one of them—and buy orders have rushed in.

entry.title: To The Moon: Astronaut Scott Kelly Launches Ethereum NFTs to Benefit Ukraine
entry.summary: The retired NASA astronaut—who holds BTC, DOGE, and more—tells Decrypt about his first NFTs and excitement for the metaverse.

entry.title: Ireland's Advertising Regulator to Review Crypto Ads Guidance
entry.summary: The ASAI is considering a review of digital assets promotions, potentially leading to a clampdown on crypto ads.

entry.title: Axie Infinity Developer Launches $1M Bug Bounty After $622M Ronin Hack
entry.summary: Sky Mavis has offered a top prize of $1,000,000 for hackers who can identify “extraordinarily severe” vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Meta Will Enable VR Creators to Sell Virtual Items in Horizon Worlds
entry.summary: A trial will enable a ‘handful’ of Horizon creators to sell virtual items to the VR app’s 300,000 monthly users.

entry.title: Astronaut Scott Kelly Discusses NFT Project, Crypto Holdings, and the Metaverse
entry.summary: Retired NASA astronaut Scott Kelly talks to Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward about his new Ethereum NFT collection, which benefits relief efforts in Ukraine, plus the cryptocurrencies he holds and his excitement about the metaverse.

entry.title: Gary Vaynerchuk-Backed Swoops Raises $3.5 Million for NFT Basketball Game
entry.summary: Courtside Ventures and Alpaca VC led the funding round, joined by Vaynerchuk, DraftKings CEO Jason Robins and several others.

entry.title: Robinhood Adds SHIB, Solana, Compound and Polygon's MATIC
entry.summary: Crypto trading platform Robinhood has listed the popular meme coin Shiba Inu (SHIB) alongside Solana and others.

entry.title: Coinbase 'Increasing Transparency' for New Listings with Q2 Asset Roadmap
entry.summary: Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has unveiled an extended list of tokens under consideration for listing in Q2 2022.

entry.title: Bitcoin Recovers $40,000 Amid Wider Crypto Market Slump
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum have both recovered key levels, even as the global crypto market cap slipped further overnight.

entry.title: Ethereum Devs Now Testing ETH 2.0 Upgrade on 'Shadow Fork'
entry.summary: Ethereum devs have created a "shadow fork" of the mainnet to better test the merge that will transition the network to proof of stake.

entry.title: Crypto Market Melts Down as Bitcoin Drops 15%, Ethereum Loses 14%
entry.summary: Bitcoin fell below $40,000, while Ethereum found itself just under $3,000.

entry.title: Animoca Acquires Eden Games to Make Crypto Racing Games After F1 Shutdown
entry.summary: Eden Games will develop NFT-powered games in Animoca’s REVV Racing ecosystem, following last month’s shuttering of F1 Delta Time.

entry.title: Elon Musk Wants Twitter Blue Subscriptions to Be Paid in Dogecoin—Is He Joking?
entry.summary: Musk recently became Twitter's largest shareholder. He has some ideas for how to improve the social media platform.

entry.title: Coinbase to Produce Bored Ape Yacht Club Animated Short Films
entry.summary: The three-part series will feature Bored Ape characters submitted by community members, and tie into Coinbase’s NFT marketplace.

entry.title: Epic Games Raises $2B to 'Build the Metaverse'—Will It Use Crypto or NFTs?
entry.summary: Sony and LEGO’s parent company are backing the Fortnite maker's metaverse plans, but it’s not clear whether Epic Games will build on blockchain networks.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club-Themed Burger Joint Debuts in California
entry.summary: Bored & Hungry began slinging burgers and fries on Saturday, with the restaurant accepting Ethereum and ApeCoin as payment.

entry.title: 72% of Financial Advisors Would Invest More in Crypto If Spot ETF Were Available: Nasdaq Survey
entry.summary: Although a majority of financial advisers would invest more in crypto if a spot ETF product were available, they don't expect one this year.

entry.title: Cathie Wood: ARK Invest 'Chose Block Over PayPal' Due To Cash App's Bitcoin Focus
entry.summary: ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood called PayPal’s Venmo a “follower” of Block’s Cash App payment system, which uses Bitcoin’s Lightning Network.

entry.title: Volt Protocol Raises $2 Million for 'Inflation-Resistant Stablecoin'
entry.summary: By pegging to an inflation index rather than a fiat currency, Volt aims to help DeFi users maintain their purchasing power.

entry.title: Binance Gains In Principle Approval in Abu Dhabi
entry.summary: Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, has secured an in-principle regulatory approval in Abu Dhabi.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Slip to Three-Week Lows
entry.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum, the industry’s two largest cryptocurrencies, are both down to almost three-week lows.

entry.title: Billionaire David Rubenstein on Crypto: ‘The Genie Is Out of the Bottle’
entry.summary: The billionaire co-founder of The Carlyle Group, David Rubenstein, has reversed his previously "skeptical" view of cryptocurrencies.

entry.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk No Longer Joining Twitter Board
entry.summary: Twitter’s CEO Parag Agrawal has announced that Elon Musk will no longer be joining the Board for the social media giant.

entry.title: Gemini COO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Gemini COO Noah Perlman talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Gemini's approach to competing with other exchanges, its focus on regulatory compliance, and his own views on Bitcoin maximalists.

entry.title: Robinhood Crypto CTO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Robinhood Crypto CTO Johann Kerbrat talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Robinhood's new Lightning Network integration, potential NFT plans, and Kerbrat's personal history with crypto, including mining Bitcoin back in 2010.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: pplpleasr and the NFT Art Revolution
entry.summary: Emily Yang aka pplpleasr never thought she'd be an online celebrity. But in 2021 an NFT version of a digital ad she did for Uniswap sold for $525,000 to a DAO of her fans, and now she's among the most famous NFT artists. She speaks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the rise of NFT art, the traditional art world taking it seriously, NFT haters, and which NFT marketplaces can beat OpenSea.

entry.title: Ice Cube: Crypto and NFTs Are ‘The Ultimate Fuck You to the Mainstream’
entry.summary: The legendary rapper, actor, and entrepreneur Ice Cube talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about why his BIG3 basketball league plans to offer fractional team ownership in the form of NFTs, plus his personal interest in crypto.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto, Taxes, and You
entry.summary: Tax Day is coming, and the crypto world is paying attention. Decrypt's Jeff Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Adriana Hamacher discuss what people and businesses need to know about crypto and taxes with special guest Nicholas Mowbray of Baker Hostetler.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: Ditching Big Banks for Bitcoin With Caitlin Long
entry.summary: Caitlin Long spent nearly two decades at big banks Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley before she went all in on Bitcoin. Now her company Custodia is seeking to offer banking services to crypto companies long shut out by the big banks. She talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about identifying as a Bitcoin maximalist, crypto regulation in DC, and Web3 culture.

entry.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."

entry.title: Crypto Taxes Got You Down? Software Can Help
entry.summary: Tax season is upon us, and crypto investors have questions. Tony Dhanjal, Head of Tax at crypto tax software service Koinly, shares tips in this sponsored segment.

entry.title: Pastel Network's Georgiades: How to Protect Your NFTs
entry.summary: Anthony Georgiades, co-founder of Pastel Network, talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at Camp Ethereal 2022 about NFT security and the importance of protecting your digital artwork.

entry.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'
entry.summary: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.

entry.title: Gitcoin's Scott Moore Talks Ukraine Fundraising Grant
entry.summary: Gitcoin co-founder Scott Moore tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson all about Gitcoin's GR13 grant, which is raising money for Ukraine and has matching participation from a range of Web3 names like OpenSea, OlympusDAO, NounsDAO, Polygon, Algorand, and more.

entry.title: The Importance of Layer 2: ConsenSys, Nomad, and LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Robert Drost, Head of R&D at ConsenSys, talks Layer 2s and building atop Ethereum with James Prestwich of Nomad and Sreeram Kannan of LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.

entry.title: ShapeShift, BeetsDAO Talk DAO Creation and Governance at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Jordan Garbis, co-founder of BeetsDAO, and Kent Barton, who does tokenomics at ShapeShift DAO, talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming about how to start a DAO, the hurdles with growing them, how to handle tokenomics and reward structure, and how to approach bad behavior by DAO members. At the end, they also took questions from the audience.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 5: Andrew Yang Wants You to Join His DAO
entry.summary: The former presidential candidate and NYC mayoral candidate has launched Lobby3, a DC lobbying DAO. He talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about his crypto journey, the potential of DAOs, and the need to blend a Web3 approach with "the old-fashioned way" to spur change in DC.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Governments and Crypto, CBDCs, and Ethereum vs Bitcoin at Camp Ethereal
entry.summary: Edward Snowden gives an extensive interview to Marta Belcher of Filecoin Foundation for Camp Ethereal 2022, taped on February 27. He talks about how governments view crypto as "an evolving threat," how crypto "transforms power relationships," why he thinks Ethereum "suffers from the same privacy problems as Bitcoin," and why he views central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) as "crypto-fascist currencies."
